properties.name: 7-11 / Glovers Pharmacy
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 Closest convenience stores; drank a lot of Slurpees. I remember a 20 cent Three Musketeers bar.

properties.name: Atlanta - 23, 24
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31305 Fulton Industrial Cir SW 30336Just a 146 mile drive from Birmingham, Atlanta has so much to offer. Six Flags over Georgia is a must-stop, as is the MLK, Jr. museum and state capitol. I\'ve heard the underground shopping downtown is amazing, and catching a Braves game would be sweet. Executive Inn at Six Flags 305 Fulton Indust Cir SW 30336

properties.name: Austin
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31austin, txHome of the University of Texas and the state capital, Austin is a good stop between San Antonio and Houston.

properties.name: Baltimore - 40
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31300 Light St 21202Just a 39 mile drive from D.C., Baltimore boasts world-famous crab cakes and the Baltimore Orioles. The Hyatt Regency at 300 Light St 21202 will be top-notch and close to the heart of downtown.

properties.name: Barstow Woods
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31  Barstow WoodsUnimproved city park on north end that included trails and a small snow hill.

properties.name: Baton Rouge
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Baton Rouge, LALouisiana state capital and home of Louisiana State University. Ought to be a nice stop.

properties.name: Birmingham - 21,22
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31275 Oxmoor Rd 35209A 238 mile drive from Memphis, Birmingham is worthy of a two-night stay. Really looking forward to seeing the state capital and the campus of UAB. I\'ve got a Birmingham Barons jersey and would love to get out to the ballpark. Howard Johnson Express 275 Oxmoor Rd 35209

properties.name: Bloomington, MN - 69,70
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan312221 Killebrew Dr 55425The Mall of America is on the old site of Minnesota\'s Metropolitan Stadium, home of the Vikings and Twins from 1961-81. Knotts Camp Snoopy is at the mall and a top-rated amusement park. A 263 mile drive from Cedar Rapids, the Country Inn Suites at 2221 Killebrew Dr 55425 is adjacent to the SuperMall. A Twins ballgame, either at the Metrodome or a new, publicly financed ballpark would be terrific to attend.

properties.name: Boston - 45, 46
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan311 Ave De Lafayette 02111The Hyatt Regency is right in the middle of downtown Boston at 1 Ave De Lafayette 02111 and within walking distance of many historic sites in the city. A side trip to Cape Cod would probably be well worth the drive. A 220 mile drive from New York City.

properties.name: Brookings, OR -3
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Brookings, ORBest Western on the ocean 16008 Lower Harbor Rd 97415. Another day looking at antiques and the home of delicious Bandon Cheese in Bandon, OR. 155 mile driving day.

properties.name: Bryans Bike Shop
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 415 E Main 48640Cool bike shop downtown

properties.name: Buffalo
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Buffalo, NYHope to snack on some Buffalo Wings in the city that started it all. Close to Niagara Falls.

properties.name: Burger Chef
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Awesome burgers. Loved the bacon cheeseburger.

properties.name: Canton, OH
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan312121 George Halas Dr SW 44708Canton was the home of Jim Thorpe and the football Indians and the cradle of pro football, and is now the seat of the Pro Football Hall of Fame. 60 miles south of Cleveland, the HOF is an awesome side trip.

properties.name: Carmel by the Sea
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Carmel by the Sea, CAClint Eastwood was one-time mayor of this beautiful California coastal community.

properties.name: Cedar Point, Sandusky, OH
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan311 Cedar Point Dr 44870The best amusement park in the midwest, Cedar Point is a convenient side trip from Cleveland.

properties.name: Cedar Rapids - 66,67,68
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan314011 16th Ave SW 52404Cedar Rapids embodies the best of the Midwest, and three days in this fantastic town should be fun. A 322 mile drive from Kansas City, the accomodations at the Ramada Ltd at 4011 16th Ave SW 52404 will be comfortable. Catching a Class A Kernels game will be an absolute necessity.

properties.name: Central Park pool / Ice rinks
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 A big city-run pool that was awesome on a hot summer day. The arena next door had two ice rinks for hockey or open skating.

properties.name: Charleston, S.C. - 33
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31144 Bee St 29401Home of some fantastic southern hospitality, old town Charleston should be terrific to visit. A 147 mile trip from Savannah via Hilton Head Island, the Comfort Inn at 144 Bee St 29401 will be a handy location to do some sightseeing.

properties.name: Chicago - 62,63
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan313434 W Broadway Ave 60657A 433 mile driving day, the Best Western at 3434 W. Broadway Ave 60657 is close to the Cubs Wrigley Field. Chicago is worthy of a two day visit, as the Museum of Natural History and the Sears Tower are great stops.

properties.name: Chippewa Nature Center
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 400 S Badour 48640Good place to see the history of the region, with some of the land farmed in the same manner that was done in the 19th century. Great place for students.

properties.name: Cincinnati - 54
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31150 W 5th St 45202Cincinnati is a 244 mile trip from Cleveland. The Queen City\'s lively downtown will be very accessable from the Millenium Hotel at 150 W 5th St 45202. I\'d love to get to a Reds game at Great America Ballpark.

properties.name: Circle Bowl
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Terrific old bowling alley. I would play video games in there. I just read that it was demolished in 1998.

properties.name: City Dairy
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Amazing ice cream shop with about 30 flavors hand-dipped. I enjoyed Blue Moon ice cream, a close relative to Superman ice cream.

properties.name: Cleveland - 53,54
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan311460 E 9th St 44114Home of the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, Cleveland has come a long way and is worthy of a two day stop. A side trip to Canton, OH and the Pro Football Hall of Fame will get squeezed in, too. A 213 mile trip from Niagara Falls, the Hampton Inn Downtown at 1460 E 9th St is close to the R&R Hall of Fame.

properties.name: Columbia, MO
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Columbia, MOSeat of the University of Missouri and state capital, Columbia is the intellectual center of the state and should be a nice stop along the trip.

properties.name: Columbus, OH
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Columbus, OHOhio\'s state capital, Columbus is right between Cleveland and Cincinnati and a good place to stop for lunch on the trip between those two cities.

properties.name: Cooperstown - 51
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan314758 State Hwy 28 13326Cooperstown is the home of the Baseball Hall of Fame, worthy of a stop along this trip. A 247 mile drive from Laconia, NH, the Holiday Inn Express Suites at 4758 State Hwy 28 13326 will be good accomodations.

properties.name: Denver - 72
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan311450 Glenarm Pl 80202The Holiday Inn Downtown at 1450 Glenarm Pl 80202 is just blocks away from the Colorado State Capitol and the Denver Convention Center in the heart of downtown. A 540 mile driving day from Omaha.

properties.name: Des Moines
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Des Moines, IAState capital of Iowa, Des Moines is worthy of a stop between K.C. and Cedar Rapids.

properties.name: Detroit
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Detroit, MIComerica Park in Detroit is a must-stop along the trip. A side trip to old Tiger Stadium would be a nice visit, too. Cobo Hall and the Renaissance Center are sweet, too.

properties.name: Dow Gardens
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Dow GardensDow Gardens is a botanical garden that includes spectacular landscaping and flowers

properties.name: El Paso - 16
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan3179925A long 420 mile journey from Tempe, AZ ends in the western end of the Lone Star State. Marriot Hotel 79925.

properties.name: Emerson Park
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Softball fields, awesome slides and along the Titabawassee River.

properties.name: Erie, PA
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Erie, PAErie is right on Lake Erie between Buffalo and Cleveland. Looking forward to visiting the lakefront.

properties.name: Eureka, CA - 4
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan314260 Broadway St Eureka, CARedwood Trees! Beautiful Humbolt County. Days Inn will be a good rest after a 111 mile driving day. 4260 Broadway St 95503

properties.name: Everglades
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Everglades National Park is the home of manatees, alligators, herons and all sorts of amazing creatures, part of a remarkably scenic drive across Florida.

properties.name: Fisherman's Wharf, San Francisco
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31175 Jefferson St 94133Ripley\'s Believe it or Not is a major attraction on San Francisco\'s Fisherman\'s Wharf district. Home to a damn good loaf of sourdough bread. Alcatraz is visible.

properties.name: Florence OR - 2
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Florence OR Best Western Hotel ought to be comfy after a fun day beachcombing from Lincoln City to Florence. 85625 Hwy 101 97439. 78 mile driving day.

properties.name: Fred Meyer store
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan3116600 SE McGillivray Blvd Vancouver WAOn 9/11/01, I was listening to the Howard Stern radio show when I heard Howard report that the first plane hit the tower. I ran to the break room where other employees had gathered to watch the news on TV. I\'ll never forget the sick feeling I had inside when I absorbed the horrible news.

properties.name: Giant grocery store
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Shopped at Giant most of the time for food.

properties.name: Glacier National Park - 75,76
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 431 miles from Yellowstone NP, Glacier National Park is renowned for its beauty. Accomodations are scarce, but can be had in one of the most remote areas in the continental US.

properties.name: Grace A. Dow Memorial Library
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Grace A. Dow Memorial LibraryTerrific library.

properties.name: Grand Canyon Village - 14
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Grand Canyon, AZSouth rim of Grand Canyon has a number of lodges; reservations via snail mail at Anfac Parks & Resorts, 14011 E Iliff Av Aurora, CO 80014. 240 mile driving day from Tempe.

properties.name: Grand Coulee, WA - 77
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Grand Coulee, WAA 321 mile drive from Glacier National Park in Montana, the Grand Coulee Dam is one of the largest dams built in the 20th century and a genuine tourist attraction in its own right. Accomodations are limited, but can be had.

properties.name: Grand Marais - 61
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan3121795 Randolph St 49839A 288 mile driving day, Grand Marais is a picturesque town along Lake Superior. The Arborgate Inn at 21795 Randolph St 49839 will be nice accomodations in this sleepy Upper Peninsula town.

properties.name: Great Grandma Smith's house
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 Great Grandma\'s place

properties.name: Green Bay
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Green Bay, WIGreen Bay is home of the NFL Packers and should be an interesting stop along the trip from Grand Marais, MI to Chicago.

properties.name: Haight-Ashbury District, San Francisco
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Center of hippie district of 1960\'s, worthy of a look here in the 21st century.

properties.name: Half Moon Bay, CA
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Half Moon Bay, CAA terrific stop coming south from San Francisco, it\'s legendary for the Hitchcock movie "The Birds".

properties.name: Hamiltons Pastry Shop
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 117 E Main 48640Best bakery in town -- great chocolate eclairs!

properties.name: Hilton Head Island, SC
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Hilton Head Island, SCA terrific stop between Savannah and Charleston, Hilton Head Island ought to be worth the detour.

properties.name: Houston - 18
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan311520 Texas Ave 77002The Inn at the Ballpark at 1520 Texas St 77002 is conveniently across the street from the Astros Minute Maid Field. 196 mile driving day.

properties.name: Huntington Beach, CA
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31  Huntington Beach, CAChic shopping, cool pier, the epitome of Orange County lifestyle on the coast. Great beachfront.

properties.name: Indianapolis
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Indianapolis, INIndianapolis is worthy of a stop along this route, as its the state capital of Indiana and home of the NFL Colts and baseball\'s Triple-A Indians.

properties.name: Jackson, MS
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Jackson, MSMississippi\'s state capital will be a short stop along the route from New Orleans to Memphis.

properties.name: Jacksonville
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Jacksonville, FLJacksonville is one of the largest cities (in square miles) in the USA and home of the Class AA Jacksonville Suns. A nice stop between Orlando and Savannah on the way up the Florida coast.

properties.name: Kansas City - 64, 65
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan319103 E 39th St 64133A 247 mile trip across Missouri from St. Louis, Kansas City is the jewel of the Midwest. The Clarion Hotel at 9103 E 39th St 64133 is close to Royals Stadium. Really looking forward to taking a whole day to visit the Harry S Truman Presidential Library in nearby Independence, MO.

properties.name: Keith C's old place
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31My buddy Keith C.\'s house on Ashman. Never will forget watching Dr. Ruth on HBO and playing ping pong at his place.

properties.name: Kroger
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan312808 Ashman 48640Never will forget pulling an OJ Simpson card out of a pack I bought at the drug store next to Kroger in 1977.

properties.name: Lake Winnipesaukee -47,48,49,50
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31974 White Oaks Rd 03246Spent some time at Lake Winnipesaukee in 1977 and can\'t wait to get back. The drive from Boston up the coast to Maine to feast on a lobster meal, then the drive to the Summit Resort in Laconia, NH is about 170 miles. Four days on the lake, canoeing the lake, will be a good rest before hitting the road again.

properties.name: Lakewood, CA - 10, 11
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Lakewood, CALakewood Mall is okay...they\'ve got a Sbarro! Marie Callender is on Candlewood, and I believe the theatre on the east end of this mega complex has 16 screens. 2 nights in Lakewood after a 116 mile drive.

properties.name: Las Cruces, NM
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31las cruces, nmOasis after a long stretch from Tuscon along I-10.

properties.name: Lincoln City - 1
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Lincoln City ORChinook Winds Casino has a pretty good seafood buffet on Friday nights. Great hotel, too. 1501 NW 40th Place. 100 mile driving day.

properties.name: Mackinaw City, MI
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Mackinaw City, MIA must-stop is at Fort Michilimackinac in Mackinaw City on the south side of the Mackinaw Straits. It\'s a fantastic rendition of the old fort that used to sit at that site.

properties.name: Marina, CA
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Marina, CACalifornia coastal city

properties.name: McDonalds / Burger King
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan311711 S Saginaw 48640McDonalds and Burger King next door to each other...very handy

properties.name: McMinnville, OR
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31McMinnville, ORThe home of picturesque Linfield College will be the first stop on this long journey.

properties.name: Memphis - 20
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan311471 East Brooks Road, Memphis, TN, 38116One of the cradles of Jazz and the home of Elvis\' palatial Graceland, Memphis should be one of the highlights of the whole trip. 397 mile driving day from New Orleans. Clarion Hotel Airport/Graceland Area 1471 E Brooks Rd 38116 901-332-3500

properties.name: Miami - 27,28
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Miami, FL280 miles across Florida through the Everglades gets you from St. Pete to Miami\'s legendary South Beach. Picturesque beaches and fantastic night life are what South Beach is all about. Should be a great two days.

properties.name: Midland Center for the Arts
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 Midland Center of the ArtsExcellent museum containing science facts and art

properties.name: Midland Community Center
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31An awesome place...basketball courts, indoor swimming pools, ping pong...lots of free stuff for kids to do.

properties.name: Midland Country Club
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31The driving range always had some balls that came close to W St. Andrews and you could pick up. A very scenic bike ride on the way from home to the library or other points downtown.

properties.name: Midland HS Stadium
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Site of some great football games over the years; no game each season is bigger than Midland vs Dow.

properties.name: Midland Home
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 636 Hillcrest 48640Moved to this home as a preschooler and lived there for eight years.

properties.name: Midland Hospital
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31  4005 Orchard Dr 48640Born there at what was then known as Midland Hospital.

properties.name: Midland, MI - 56,57,58,59,60
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31111 W Main St 48640A 74 mile drive from St. Johns via Mount Pleasant, Midland is the home of Dow Chemical and the place of my birth. The Marriott Ashman Court is the best hotel in town at 111 W Main St 48640 and the site of the old JC Penney building. The five day stay ought to give me time to reacquaint myself to my hometown.

properties.name: Milwaukee
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Milwaukee, WIMilwaukee is beer city and home of "Happy Days" and "Laverne and Shirley". Will probably have to check out the MLB Brewers Miller Park on the way through town.

properties.name: New Bern, NC - 34
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31100 Middle St 28560After a 261 mile trip along the Carolinas coast from Charleston, SC, the Sheraton at 100 Middle St 28560 ought to provide a good nights rest.

properties.name: New Orleans - 19
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31614 Canal St 70130Bourbon Street is a hell of a place to party from all accounts. New Orleans is bouncing back from the disasterous flooding in 2005 and ought to be a fun stop after the 348 mile driving day from Houston. JW Marriott Hotel 614 Canal St 70130

properties.name: New York - 41,42,43
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31811 7th Ave 10019New York is the center of the world, and the Sheraton NY Hotel and Towers 811 7th Ave 10019 is right in the middle of the action. The Big Apple is only 103 miles from Philadelphia. There are so many places to visit, such as the Statue of Liberty, the Empire State Building, Central Park, Times Square, etc. Ought to be an awesome three days.

properties.name: Newport Beach, CA
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31  Newport Beach, CAThe crown jewel of Orange County, this is one of the most affluent communities in the USA. Nice pier and white-sand beach.

properties.name: Niagara Falls, NY - 52
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Niagara Falls, NYA 252 mile driving day from Cooperstown, the Niagara Falls are world famous and a terrific stop along this trip. The Best Western Summitt Inn at 9500 Niagara Falls Blvd 14704 will be convenient to the falls.

properties.name: Northeast Intermediate School
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 Northeast Intermediate SchoolAttended Seventh Grade and Eighth Grade at Northeast. Go Vikings!

properties.name: Nugents Drug Store
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 3102 Jefferson 48640Terrific drug store on the Ashman Circle that had a lunch counter, baseball cards and comic books

properties.name: Old A & P store
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 Good independent grocery store, across Saginaw Rd from my bank.

properties.name: Old Cinema
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 Saw Star Wars seven times during its first run in 1977 at this old four screen theatre.

properties.name: Old Circle Mall
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 A tiny mall that didn\'t have any good stores at all. The arrival of the Midland Mall at Eastman Road and US 10 was the death of this development.

properties.name: Old JC Penney store
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 Old-school JC Penney building; now a conference hotel. Found a similar style JC Penney in Astoria, OR. Got my cub scout uniform there.

properties.name: Old Sears building
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 Historic old downtown Sears store. I bought a 00 ten-speed bike there with my own money.

properties.name: Old T-Way store
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 Discount store that seemed to have everything cheap. Presumably this company is out of business.

properties.name: Old Woolworths
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Old school Woolworths had a lunch counter and a cool drug store with lots of toys.

properties.name: Omaha - 71
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan311001 Cass St 68102An evening in Omaha ought to be pleasant after a 368 mile drive from the Twin Cities. The Hilton Omaha at 1001 Cass St 68102 is close to a number of downtown attractions.

properties.name: Orlando - 29,30,31
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan318738 International Ave 32819Orlando is a must-stop on this trip, a 249-mile driving day from Miami. Central Florida features DisneyWorld, Universal Studios Orlando and the Class A Lakeland Tigers. The Best Western Plaza International Orlando at 8738 Int. Ave 32819 is a centrally-located, reasonably priced hotel.

properties.name: Pacific Grove, CA - 7
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31557 Ocean View Blvd 93950Can\'t wait for the sunset in this city near Carmel, CA. 140 mile driving day ends at 7 Gates Inn, 557 Ocean View Blvd 93950.

properties.name: Panama City, FL - 25
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan3112818 Front Beach Rd 32407The Days Inn Panama City Beach 12818 Front Beach Rd 32407 is right on the white beachfront. I\'ve heard it\'s a partying town; My dad spent some time in the Air Force in Panama City. 288 mile driving day from Atlanta.

properties.name: Paper Route/East
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Paper Route 1980-82/EastDelivered Detroit Free Press; Route included Columbia Rd Linwood DR, W. Meadowbrook Dr, Crescent Dr, Berkshire Ct, Bond Ct, Dykman Rd, Clover Ln, Linden Dr and Arbor Dr

properties.name: Paper Route/West
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Paper Route 1980-82/WestDetroit Free Press paper route included Arbor Dr, Linden Dr, Clover Ln, Dyckman Rd, Parkway, Berkshire Ct, Bond Ct, Crescent Dr, W. Meadowbrook, Hampden Ct, Linwood Dr, Columbia Rd

properties.name: Pebble Beach
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31  Pebble Beach, CAWorld-famous oceanside links. Probably mission impossible to get a tee time, but it would be unforgettable. Just north of Carmel by the Sea, CA.

properties.name: Philadelphia - 41
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31400 Arch St 19106Philadelphia is only 103 miles from Baltimore and boasts the Liberty Bell and Constitution Hall at Independence Mall Historical Park. The Holiday Inn Historical District at 400 Arch St 19106 is within walking distance of all the historical sites in the City of Brotherly Love. I\'d love to catch a Phillies game while in town, too.

properties.name: Pismo Beach
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31  Pismo Beach, CABeautiful beach north of Santa Barbara, CA immortalized by Bugs Bunny in Warner Brothers cartoons.

properties.name: Pizza Hut
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Good service back in the 1970\'s. I enjoyed eating salad with Romano cheese dressing. There was a big plastic chest with cheap toys made in Hong Kong that kids could get a toy from.

properties.name: Pizza Sams
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31102 W Main 48640Terrific pizza place downtown

properties.name: Plymouth Park / Plymouth Pool
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Plymouth ParkCity park complete with outdoor pool. Took swimming lessons there.

properties.name: Saginaw
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Saginaw, MIHad some fantastic times watching the Saginaw Gears of the International Hockey League at the Saginaw Civic Center from 1978-81 and am looking forward to seeing this city again.

properties.name: San Antonio - 17
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31123 Losoya Street Suite 5, San Antonio, TX, 78205A grueling 551 mile journey across west Texas ends on the riverwalk in San Antonio. The Hyatt Regency at 123 Losoya St should provide top-flight accomodations.

properties.name: San Antonio - Six Flags Fiesta Texas
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Six Flags Fiesta TexasIf an extra day in San Antonio can be squeezed out, a trip to Six Flags Fiesta Texas would be an awesome visit.

properties.name: San Diego - 12
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31333 W Harbor Dr 92101I love that this picture has the Padres Petco Field under construction. The Marriot hotel at 333 W Harbor Dr was a 110 mile drive from Lakewood. One day in San Diego probably won\'t be enough; I hear the nightlife in old San Diego is awesome.

properties.name: San Diego Zoo
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31San Diego ZooIt would be great to squeeze in a four-hour trip to San Diego\'s world-renowned Zoo. Koala Bears are cute as hell. I\'d rather do the Zoo than Sea World.

properties.name: San Francisco - 5,6
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31966 Harrison St 94107San Francisco! What a town: sourdough bread, Ghiradelli chocolate, Chinatown, the Golden Gate Bridge, Haight-Ashbury, street cars, and the SF Giants. Two day stay in SF. The Bay Bridge inn is less than a mile from the ballpark at 966 Harrison St 94107. 268 mile driving day.

properties.name: San Simeon, CA - 8
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan319415 Hearst Dr San Simeon, CAThe Hearst Castle will be an amazing tour after a scenic driving day along the California coast. Best Western Cavalier 9415 Hearst Dr San Simeon, CA. 99 mile driving day.

properties.name: Santa Barbara - 9
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31324 W Mason St 93101Terrific way to end the tour of coastal California in sunny Santa Barbara. 144 mile driving day ends at Mason Beach Inn 324 W Morton St 93101.

properties.name: Sarasota
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Sarasota, FLMy grandparents wintered in Sarasota for about ten years in the 1970\'s and it\'s been 30 years since I was there; I\'m looking forward to the return trip. The Ringling Brothers/Barnum & Bailey Circus began in sunny Sarasota.

properties.name: Savannah - 32
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31412 W Bay St 31401The Hyatt Regency at 412 W Bay St 31401 ought to be a great hotel to relax at after a 280 mile drive from Orlando. Savannah is a classic southern city that should offer a lot of sightseeing opportunity.

properties.name: Seal Beach, CA
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31  Seal Beach, CATerrific downtown complete with Irish Pubs and eateries next to the pier. Good beach, too.

properties.name: Sids Superette
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 810 Ashman 48640Fantastic convenience store. They had a prominent rack of Playboy and Penthouse magazines and hand-packed ice cream, too.

properties.name: Six Flags Magic Mountain
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Greatest roller coasters on the west coast; a must visit when in SoCal.

properties.name: Snow Hill / Toboggan Run
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31  This city-run park was the best place to sled. The toboggan run was awesome, and the hot chocolate was always good.

properties.name: Spokane
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Spokane, WAHad some terrific times in Spokane as a teenager and it will be worthwhile to make a stop here along the trip.

properties.name: St. Augustine, FL
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31St. Augustine, FLVisited St. Augustine in the late 1970\'s and I\'m looking forward to seeing the place again. This early settlement was among the earliest by Europeans in North America.

properties.name: St. Brigids Catholic Church/School
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 Baptized there.

properties.name: St. John's Lutheran Church/School
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Attended this school from second grade to fifth grade. Played basketball.

properties.name: St. Johns - 55
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Saint Johns, MIA 380 mile trip from Cincinnati via Indianapolis, I lived in St. Johns in the early 1970\'s as my dad finished up college at Michigan State. The St. Johns Motel at 1212 N US Hwy 27 48879 will be modest accomodations.

properties.name: St. Johns Episcopal Church
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31St. Johns Episcopal ChurchSpent a lot of time at their playground; I remember when my sister got leeches on her from the creek.

properties.name: St. Louis - 63
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31200 S 4th St 63102A 294 mile drive from Chicago, St. Louis is home of the Gateway Arch and the baseball Cardinals. The Millenium Hotel at 200 S 4th St 63102 is adjacent to all the downtown hot spots.

properties.name: St. Petersburg - 26
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan316200 Gulf Blvd 33706Right on the Gulf Coast, the Best Western Beachfront Resort 6200 Gulf Blvd 33706 should be a terrific way to spend the evening after a 373 mile driving day.

properties.name: Sugnet Elementary
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31Sugnet ElementaryAttended Kidnergarten with Mrs. Bunting, First Grade with Mrs. Moe, and Sixth Grade with Mrs. Weller

properties.name: Sunset Beach, CA
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31  Sunset Beach, CAOne of my favorite stops in SoCal with plenty of free beach access. Handy to I-605, I-405 and Cal 22.

properties.name: Tempe, AZ - 13, 15
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan315300 S Priest 85283Three days in the Valley of the Sun in springtime will be awesome: Camelback Mountain, Diamondbacks baseball, and Tempe\'s Arizona State University. Holiday Inn Express 5300 S Priest 85283. 364 mile driving day across the desert from San Diego, then 240 mile return trip from Grand Canyon Village.

properties.name: Train Station restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 An Italian restaurant that included an old rail car. The place used to play silent movies and provide a musical score. Good food.

properties.name: Tuscon

properties.name: University of California-Berkeley
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan312200 University Ave 94720Prestigious Cal-Berkeley has a picturesque campus. A must-visit in the Bay Area.

properties.name: Washington D.C. - 36,37,38,39
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan311600 Pennsylvania Ave Washington, DCWashington D.C. is the cradle of democracy and it ought to be easy to find things to do for four days in the nation\'s capital. Love the Washington, Lincoln and Jefferson Memorials and a tour of the US Capitol and White House will be amazing. The Smithsonian has Archie Bunker\'s chair and thousands of other precious items from this great nation\'s history. A 152 mile driving day from Williamsburg, VA.

properties.name: Wendys
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan311612 S Saginaw 48640Wendy\'s Hamburgers were a regular stop...fell in love with the Triple!

properties.name: Williamsburg, VA - 35
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31902 Richmond Rd 23185Historic Williamsburg, VA has a remarkable historic district and ought to be terrific to check out. A 210 mile driving day, the Days Inn Downtown at 902 Richmond Rd 23185 is close to the historic site.

properties.name: Yellowstone National Park - 73,74
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 Yellowstone, WY590 miles from Denver, Yellowstone National Park is a national treasure. There are a number of lodges to choose from. Old Faithful geyser may be the most-popular attraction. Many thanks to Teddy Roosevelt for setting aside this amazing park for future generations.

properties.name: Yellowstone Park - 73,74
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan31 Yellowstone, WY590 miles from Denver, Yellowstone National Park has a number of lodges to choose from. Old Faithful geyser is a must-see, and a scenic drive through the park is sure to feature either a moose or a bear.
